creditline: Gift of Frank Jewett Mather Jr.
inscribed:
in graphite, lower left: May 1856
in graphite, lower right: The the trains [underlined]have, subordinated | to them, the opposite quality | of clusters [underlined], as under D & E. | Farewell soft clusters--the | only pretty things about the premi | ses --ye are to be moved this evening | and to have a scraped scalp of "Respectability"!
in graphite, upper left: daisy more regular | middle yellow || Actual size
in graphite, upper center: Actual size. | Bright yell. | glaring like | the sun (of the poet)
in graphite, upper right: In the midst of most silky [illegible] little | beds of small clustering leaves will a | texture like frosted gold as A = some | time very minute as B | After rain the under parts of the [illegible] very juicy--warm | er & deeper than lights which in a breeze quiver [underlined] = quivers | in trains-- something like barley field --see below at C.
